scenario_text.value:
(Hm? Is that Kaito over there? What’s he
doing out here by himself?)
Hey, Kaito!
Oh... T-Takuma...!

(That’s odd. Something about the way Kaito’s
acting seems off.)
Is anything wrong? You seem a bit flustered.

What? Uh, no! No problem, nothing’s wrong
here!

Oh, who am I trying to kid? Look, here’s
what’s been bothering me.
I want to keep Miu safe, no matter what.

But, if I’m honest, I can barely manage to
look out for myself.

(I always think of Kaito as being so strong.
I didn’t realize he felt this way.)

There are times I want to rely on my friends,
but...if I did, I’d feel like a failure.

Not that I think badly of any of you, I just
want to be the one to protect Miu.
So tell me, Takuma, what do you think?

I wish there was some way out of this
situation.
What should I say?
Try talking it out.
Focus on yourself.
Why not be the leader?

I don’t know, maybe you should try talking it
out with everyone.

Sorry, but I’m not about to call some class
meeting over this like we’re in school.
Maybe that would work back in our world...
...but here, we’d risk getting eaten alive.
Still...maybe someday it’d be worth trying.
Well, you can’t change other people.

I think the quickest solution would be to
focus on improving yourself.
That ought to change things up a bit.

Focus on improving myself, huh? Maybe that’s
not such a bad idea...
So, why don’t you be the leader?
What? Me? The leader?!

Yeah, that way you’d be in charge of
everyone.

Don’t be stupid! You think I could handle all
that responsibility?

I’m having a hard enough time just taking
care of Miu.
Still, thanks, Takuma.

This is the sort of thing I couldn’t talk
about with anyone else. Thanks for listening.

Being able to put things into words helps,
you know?

Yeah, well, it’s not like I did anything
special.
Nah, you did plenty. Oh, and sorry, but...
I got it. I won’t say anything to the others.
Phew... Thanks.
